title: Ticket #822: gt2 jobs with GridJobId crash gridmanager on startup
description:
This bug was introduced in 7.3.2 with the GRAM5 code. In the constructor for GlobusJob, if the job ad has a valid GridJobId attribute, SetRemoteJobId() is called, which tries to invoke a method on myResource, which is still NULL at this point, resulting in a crash.

The call to myResource is to determine whether the resource is gt2 or gt5. Since the constructor knows the answer, the short-term fix is to add an optional argument to SetRemoteJobId(), which is used if myResource is NULL.

Part of the problem is that we have some circular reasoning going on. SetRemoteJobId() sets GridJobId in the job ad and updates some related data members. But the constructor is calling it with the value from GridJobId to just initialize the data members. We're not going to worry about that for now.
